00:00:01:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:01:060000.Dialogue: Are you from the Star Wars universe? - Were you in the original trilogy?

00:00:07:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:07:040000.Dialogue: Is there a picture of you in my wallet wearing a metal bikini?

00:00:15:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:15:020000.Dialogue: And no, I'm not Princess Leia.

00:00:16:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:16:210000.Dialogue: Okay. My turn. Are you in all six Star Wars movies?

00:00:34:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:34:140000.Dialogue: That's preposterous. I do not resemble C-3PO. Don't get me wrong. I'm flattered. I just don't see it.

00:00:47:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:47:040000.Dialogue: Leslie Winkle. You've reached Friends with Benefits.

00:00:52:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:52:100000.Dialogue: For a booty call, press one now.

00:00:57:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:210000.Dialogue: What exactly does that expression mean, friends with benefits? Does he provide her with health insurance?

00:01:06:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:06:200000.Dialogue: Imagine you maintained a friendship with someone you had sex with, but you were free to date whoever you wanted.

00:01:14:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:14:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I can't imagine any of that.

00:01:18:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:18:040000.Dialogue: - I believe it's my turn. You may begin your questions whenever you're ready.

00:01:34:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:34:150000.Dialogue: Aren't you leaving for your booty call?

00:01:36:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:36:150000.Dialogue: No, it was something else. Why does everything have to be about sex with you? Come on. Whose turn is it?

00:01:45:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:080000.Dialogue: Let's see. Are you from a TV series?

00:01:53:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:53:160000.Dialogue: I bet he's someone from Babylon 5. We're never going to get it.

00:02:21:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:21:000000.Dialogue: What happened? Why did she dump you?

00:02:23:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:23:040000.Dialogue: I don't know. She just said, Howard, Mama's a rolling stone.

00:02:29:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:29:230000.Dialogue: Then her call waiting beeped and she was gone.

00:02:35:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:35:030000.Dialogue: I don't understand. If you were in a non-emotional relationship, then why are you having what appears to be an emotional response?

00:02:43:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:43:150000.Dialogue: He obviously had feelings for her.

00:02:45:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:45:180000.Dialogue: Of course I had feelings for her. I saw her naked, for God's sake.

00:02:51:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:51:130000.Dialogue: Okay, you just need to get your mind off it. Do you want to go to the comic book store? - Maybe go see a movie?

00:02:55:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:55:170000.Dialogue: - I don't want to go anywhere.

00:02:59:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:59:050000.Dialogue: You know, I'm given to understand that there's an entire city in Nevada designed specifically to help people like Howard forget their problems.

00:03:10:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:10:110000.Dialogue: They can replace them with new problems, such as alcoholism, gambling addiction, and sexually transmitted diseases.

00:03:18:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:18:090000.Dialogue: Is it me, or was that Sheldon's way of saying, Vegas, baby!?

00:03:24:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:24:220000.Dialogue: - I've never been there. Have you?

00:03:32:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:32:120000.Dialogue: It could be fun. My weekend's wide open, now that...

00:03:39:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:39:120000.Dialogue: Okay, let's do this. Let's go to Las Vegas.

00:03:43:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:43:230000.Dialogue: Why not? People do things right now, all the time. Why can't we be right now people, too? Go home, pack a bag, and we'll be right now people. I have to stop at the drug store to refill a prescription, but after that, we'll go right now.

00:04:02:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:02:140000.Dialogue: - What are you gonna tell your mother?

00:04:19:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:19:040000.Dialogue: Great. We'll bring you back a t-shirt.

00:04:31:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:31:100000.Dialogue: And how are you this fine evening?

00:04:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:39:160000.Dialogue: I'm just in a good mood. While my compatriots are in Las Vegas, I will be enjoying a blissful evening in my personal Fortress of Solitude.

00:04:48:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:48:100000.Dialogue: That's Superman's big ice thingy, right?

00:04:51:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:51:210000.Dialogue: You know, I'm in such a good mood, I'm actually finding your tenuous grasp of the English language folksy and charming today.

00:05:02:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:02:120000.Dialogue: That is the intoxicating aroma of Kadhai Paneer, a perfect culinary representation of the freedom this evening holds. Not only is it Indian cuisine, which Koothrappali loathes, it contains a generous helping of peanuts, which would reduce Wolowitz to a wheezing 97-pound blister.

00:05:20:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:20:160000.Dialogue: And finally, its main ingredient is paneer, a farmer's cheese that would cause Leonard to render any room uninhabitable within minutes.

00:05:38:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:38:030000.Dialogue: I realize you're also on your own tonight, so if, at some point, you find yourself with nothing to do, please do not disturb me.

00:06:05:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:05:030000.Dialogue: What's wrong, Superman? Locked out of your big ice thingy?

00:06:17:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:17:140000.Dialogue: Look at this. Mouthwash, lotion, body wash. Shampoo and conditioner together in one tiny bottle. I love Las Vegas.

00:06:28:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:28:090000.Dialogue: Howard, could I borrow some aftershave?

00:06:40:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:40:050000.Dialogue: First row are your musks. Second is woods, leathers and botanicals. Third is assorted pheromones. Tread lightly.

00:07:04:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:04:090000.Dialogue: You guys go ahead. I just have to finish up an email.

00:07:07:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:07:200000.Dialogue: That's not an email. That's Leslie's Facebook page.

00:07:11:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:11:050000.Dialogue: Okay, fine. I'm checking her Facebook page. Look at her status update. She's saying she dumped me. People need to know I dumped her.

00:07:21:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:21:070000.Dialogue: Grow up, Raj. There's no place for truth on the Internet.

00:07:27:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:27:090000.Dialogue: Just go. I'll catch up with you.

00:07:31:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:31:180000.Dialogue: We should have a plan in case one of us gets lucky.

00:07:37:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:37:130000.Dialogue: Okay, if I get lucky, I'll take her to my stately manor outside Gotham City, and...

00:07:44:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:44:020000.Dialogue: if you get lucky, I'll sleep on the moon.

00:07:51:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:51:200000.Dialogue: Hang on. I think the emergency key is around here somewhere.

00:07:57:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:57:140000.Dialogue: Our keys go in a bowl.

00:08:02:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:02:190000.Dialogue: So, how did the beautiful mind of Sheldon Cooper forget his key in the first place?

00:08:07:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:07:190000.Dialogue: I left them in the bowl.

00:08:11:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:11:060000.Dialogue: I just remembered where the emergency key is.

00:08:15:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:15:200000.Dialogue: - I went in there a few weeks ago and you guys weren't home and I forgot it there.

00:08:20:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:20:190000.Dialogue: You went in my... Why would... What are you saying?

00:08:24:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:24:090000.Dialogue: It's not a big deal. I was making coffee and I ran out of milk.

00:08:31:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:31:100000.Dialogue: Leonard said I was crazy, but I knew that carton felt lighter.

00:08:35:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:35:170000.Dialogue: All right. Just calm down. I will call the building manager and he'll come open your door. Eat your dinner here while you're waiting.

00:08:42:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:42:050000.Dialogue: Eat? My dinner? In your apartment?

00:08:46:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:46:120000.Dialogue: Sure. Why not? And after the sun's down, we can all pile in my pickup and go skinny-dipping down at the creek.

00:08:54:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:230000.Dialogue: 'Cause today's the day to stop making sense.

00:09:00:230000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:00:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:01:200000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:01:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:01:200000.Dialogue: I'm telling you, Leonard... video slots... free drinks brought to us by a bosomy barmaid and all you can eat shrimp for $3.95.

00:09:11:150000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:11:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:16:120000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:16:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:16:120000.Dialogue: This is the real happiest place on earth.

00:09:22:210000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:22:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:22:210000.Dialogue: Dude, check it out! That's laundry for a month!

00:09:28:130000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:28:130000.Speaker: Woman

00:09:36:090000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:36:090000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:38:230000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:38:230000.Speaker: Woman

00:09:43:180000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:43:180000.Speaker: Woman

00:09:48:150000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:48:150000.Speaker: Woman

00:09:51:020000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:51:020000.Speaker: Michaela
00:09:51:020000.Dialogue: So, you interested in a little party?

00:09:54:130000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:54:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:54:130000.Dialogue: Why, yes, I love to party.

00:09:57:070000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:09:57:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:57:070000.Dialogue: Party is my middle name. Or, it would be if it weren't Ramayan.

00:10:03:220000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:03:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:03:220000.Dialogue: - Can I talk to you for a moment?

00:10:14:230000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:14:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:14:230000.Dialogue: Yeah. I really need to talk to you.

00:10:17:210000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:17:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:17:210000.Dialogue: Excuse me. I'll be right back. Don't go anywhere. Don't move. Just stay the beautiful, unspoiled American flower that you are.

00:10:26:110000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:26:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:26:110000.Dialogue: What's wrong with you, dude? That woman was all up in my jammy.

00:10:30:100000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:30:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:30:100000.Dialogue: Okay, I hate to break this to you and whatever your jammy is, but...

00:10:35:050000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:35:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:35:050000.Dialogue: I'm pretty sure she's a prostitute.

00:10:37:210000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:37:210000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:42:150000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:42:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:42:150000.Dialogue: Let me put it this way: In your entire life, how many gorgeous women have walked straight up to you in a bar and asked if you wanted to party?

00:10:52:170000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:52:170000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:56:000000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:10:56:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:56:000000.Dialogue: Maybe, but I'm guessing it'll cost you about $500 an hour to try.

00:11:05:030000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:05:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:05:030000.Dialogue: It was lovely meeting you. Best of luck in your future endeavors.

00:11:10:180000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:10:180000.Speaker: Michaela

00:11:14:010000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:14:010000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:20:070000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:20:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:20:070000.Dialogue: Howard's losing it. Check out his latest Twitters. I'm at the bottom of a black hole staring into the abyss. My life is meaningless. My future is without hope.

00:11:31:080000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:31:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:31:080000.Dialogue: Why don't we take him to see the Blue Man Group?

00:11:34:200000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:34:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:36:040000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:36:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:36:040000.Dialogue: USA Today calls them exuberant fun for the whole family.

00:11:40:110000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:40:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:40:110000.Dialogue: I don't know, Howard isn't really the family fun kind of guy.

00:11:44:210000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:44:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:44:210000.Dialogue: It's too bad he wasn't here for that hooker. She's exactly his type; a hooker.

00:11:51:220000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:51:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:51:220000.Dialogue: You know, I bet if we hired her, that would cheer him up.

00:11:55:130000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:11:55:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:55:130000.Dialogue: We're not gonna get Wolowitz a hooker.

00:12:02:110000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:12:02:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:02:110000.Dialogue: I'm so lonely and horny, I may open this $20 jar of peanuts and end it all.

00:12:13:160000.Scene: A bar at the Las Vegas Casino.
00:12:13:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:160000.Dialogue: I suppose it wouldn't hurt to get an estimate.

00:12:25:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:25:060000.Dialogue: Are you trying to make small talk? Sweetie, you really don't have to.

00:12:38:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:38:220000.Dialogue: They shifted my schedule around at the restaurant, - so my hours are gonna be...

00:12:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:41:110000.Dialogue: - I'm sorry. That's not going to interest me at all. Just eat.

00:13:00:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:00:050000.Dialogue: If you're not busy, we were thinking maybe you could...

00:13:24:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:24:220000.Dialogue: The thing is, we've got this friend, and he's kind of down in the dumps. And we thought maybe you could cheer him up.

00:13:35:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:35:080000.Dialogue: I think she knows what I meant.

00:13:37:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:37:010000.Dialogue: How when you beat around the bush? She's from the mean streets where they shoot from the hip and keep it real.

00:13:44:050000.Speaker: Michaela
00:13:44:050000.Dialogue: Don't worry. I can take good care of your friend.

00:13:46:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:46:210000.Dialogue: Okay, terrific. Listen, is there a way that we can do this where he doesn't know that you're a, you know...

00:14:00:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:00:230000.Dialogue: Yes. Yeah, exactly. The girlfriend experience.

00:14:04:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:04:060000.Dialogue: Actually, if it's not too much to ask, could we have the Jewish girlfriend experience?

00:14:11:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:11:130000.Dialogue: Okay, that's question 20. You have to guess.

00:14:16:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:16:090000.Dialogue: I don't know, Sheldon. Are you Star Wars?

00:14:22:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:22:020000.Dialogue: How can one person be a whole movie?

00:14:25:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:25:230000.Dialogue: I give up. Can we just do something else?

00:14:36:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:36:210000.Dialogue: Are you and Leonard friends with benefits?

00:14:40:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:40:050000.Dialogue: What? Are you and Leonard friends with benefits?

00:14:43:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:43:200000.Dialogue: Where did that even come from? Did he say we were?

00:14:46:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:090000.Dialogue: No, Leonard said nothing. But who knows what goes on over here when he pretends your mail was misdelivered?

00:14:59:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:59:010000.Dialogue: I'm curious about the whole social construct. On its face, the idea of satisfying one's sexual appetite, assuming one is afflicted with such,

00:15:08:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:08:060000.Dialogue: without emotional entanglement, that seems eminently practical. What I've observed, however, is Howard Wolowitz crying like a little girl.

00:15:19:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:19:110000.Dialogue: Some people just can't handle that kind of relationship.

00:15:28:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:28:200000.Dialogue: Are you able to have sex with men without developing an emotional attachment?

00:15:33:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:33:230000.Dialogue: I really... don't want to talk about this with you.

00:15:38:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:38:030000.Dialogue: Is this conversation making you uncomfortable?

00:15:40:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:40:050000.Dialogue: Of course it's making me uncomfortable. Can't you tell?

00:15:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:42:230000.Dialogue: I really have no idea. I don't particularly excel at reading facial expressions...

00:15:56:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:56:050000.Dialogue: All right, where are these amazing shrimp?

00:16:03:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:03:040000.Dialogue: Seriously, you think this is the size of a baby's arm?

00:16:10:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:10:190000.Dialogue: I'm going back to the room.

00:16:12:170000.Speaker: Michaela
00:16:12:170000.Dialogue: Boy, would it maybe kill them to put out a nice brisket?

00:16:38:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:38:230000.Dialogue: I don't think the manager's coming tonight, so here.

00:16:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:230000.Dialogue: Are you suggesting I sleep on the couch?

00:16:46:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:46:080000.Dialogue: It wasn't the first suggestion that came to mind, but it's the one I'm going with.

00:16:51:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:51:140000.Dialogue: I can't sleep on your couch. I sleep in a bed. And given its dimensions, I have no intention of living out Snickering's beloved children's book, The Tall Man From Cornwall.

00:17:04:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:04:050000.Dialogue: There was a tall man from Cornwall whose length exceed his bed. My body fits on it, but barely upon it, there's no room for my big Cornish head.

00:17:19:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:19:070000.Dialogue: All right, I will give you my bed on one condition: that you promise to zip your hole for the next eight hours.

00:17:27:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:27:140000.Dialogue: May I say one last thing?

00:17:43:120000.Speaker: Michaela
00:17:43:120000.Dialogue: Turn-ons? Let me see. Reading a good book in front of the fire, long walks on the beach... and getting freaky on the Sabbath with a bacon cheeseburger.

00:18:16:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:16:010000.Dialogue: Cut the crap. You set this up, didn't you?

00:18:26:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:26:070000.Dialogue: You already gave her the money? Thank you!

00:18:47:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:47:050000.Dialogue: Maybe that's because your hole is still open.

00:18:55:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:55:150000.Dialogue: Your home is 20 feet from here.

00:19:02:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:02:010000.Dialogue: It's in a galaxy far, far away.

00:19:06:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:06:060000.Dialogue: Damn it. What do you want me to do?

00:19:18:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:18:130000.Dialogue: That's only for when you're sick.

00:19:22:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:22:030000.Dialogue: Homesick is a type of being sick.

00:19:28:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:28:020000.Dialogue: Come on, do I really have to?

00:19:31:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:31:080000.Dialogue: I suppose we can stay up and talk.

00:19:38:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:38:070000.Dialogue: Warm kitty Little ball of fur Happy kitty

00:19:59:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:59:050000.Dialogue: Soft kitty Warm kitty Little ball of fur Happy kitty Sleepy kitty Purr, purr, purr

00:20:17:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:17:080000.Dialogue: Thank you for letting me stay here.

00:20:26:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:26:220000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm sleepy now. Get out.

00:20:41:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:41:040000.Dialogue: What were you doing at Penny's?

00:20:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:42:230000.Dialogue: Well, we had dinner, played some games, and then I spent the night.

00:20:48:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:48:140000.Dialogue: You'll be happy to know that I now have a much better understanding of friends with benefits.
